long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: with old chroot: mock -r fedora-21-x86_64 --old-chroot --cwd /tmp --chroot 'pwd'
... [output skipped] INFO: Mock Version: 1.2.13 Finish: chroot init INFO: Running in chroot: ['pwd'] Start: chroot ['pwd'] /tmp Finish: chroot ['pwd'] Finish: run
new chroot: mock -r fedora-21-x86_64 --new-chroot --cwd /tmp --chroot 'pwd' ... [output skipped] Start: chroot ['pwd'] Spawning namespace container on /var/lib/mock/fedora-21-x86_64/root (console is /dev/pts/9). Init process in the container running as PID 27548. / Finish: chroot ['pwd'] Finish: run
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 1.2.13-1
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. run mock -r fedora-21-x86_64 --new-chroot --cwd /tmp --chroot 'pwd'
Actual results: printing '/'
Expected results: printing '/tmp'
Additional info: As a workaround we can add some notes about the issue in man page.
Notes for myself - possible duplicate of bug 1262887.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
nope. it is not duplicate. And it still apply
Fixed in commit: * 9a4c465 (HEAD -> devel, origin/devel) pass cwd option to systemd-nspawn [RHBZ#1264508]
